page.title: 04Landscape
page.content: This block lies to the south-east of Lincoln and straddles the river Witham. The Witham is historically a natural boundary between the parts of Lincolnshire,in this case Kesteven and Lindsey. Even today the river is a major barrier the only crossing points for vehicular traffic being at Lincoln and Bardney. We were lucky in that there is a footbridge across the River at 058,716 this enable groups to gain access to the far bank without prohibitive travel costs. Little use is made of this route by the general public since the closure and removal of the railway to Bardney. The river has been an important routeway since Roman times and recently featured in the B.B.C. Programme "The Grain Run". Today its use is limited to pleasure craft.
